page.title: 04Some Flowers of Arden
page.content: In spring the area is covered with bluebells. The first flowers to come out are the coltsfoot, daisies and celandines. Soon there are dandelions, wood sorrel and wood anemonies. The violets and primroses sometimes grow near the burns and they are very bright. Comfrey, cuckoo flower, pink campion, pignuts, wild garlic and herb robert come in late spring. In summer the wild roses grow beside the roads. Lady's slipper and lady's mantle can be seen. Everywhere there are buttercups. Later the heather on the hills makes them look purple. The rosebay willowherb and knap weed come out. In autumn the hips and haws make the bushes bright. .
